meaningMnemonic: Remember 殴る, which means "to punch"? Well, add on 合う and you've got <vocabulary>punches</vocabulary> that have <vocabulary>come together</vocabulary> with other punches. By "come together" I mean your fist is coming in contact with someone's face, and their fist is coming in contact with your kidneys. In other words, this is a <vocabulary>fistfight</vocabulary>.
readingMnemonic: The readings come from 殴る and 合う, punched together.
